channel.title: TOR not starting after Whonix 14 manual upgrade
channel.description:
Had a perfectly fine Whonix 13 running in VirtualBox on MacOS 10.13.6 when forced to update to 14 today.
On booting into 14 I get this:
**whonixcheck** fails _Tor Pid Check Result_ Tor not running (tor_pid)message: Pid file /var/run/tor/tor.pid does not exist.) **Applications:System:Restart Tor** reports _"Failed to start Anonymizing overlay network for TCP."_
First upgraded VirtualBox app and the Oracle addons, no drama.
Followed step by step the [manual upgrade directions for non-Qubes Whonix](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Upgrading_Whonix_13_to_Whonix_14) - last updated Oct 22 2018
Started with **workstation**, then did **gateway**. Once the workstation finished downloading `apt-get-noninteractive dist-upgrade`, I started the gateway update.
Same thing happened on both: All fine until after the final step `sudo apt-get install --reinstall virtualbox-guest-*` I go to save Konsole output and KDE immediately crashes. Reboot the virtual machines and TOR no longer works as described above.
I've seen other threads like this, but none of the solutions make any sense to my mid-level UNIX head. Could you please summarize the solution for me?

item.title: TOR not starting after Whonix 14 manual upgrade
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.source: TOR not starting after Whonix 14 manual upgrade

item.title: TOR not starting after Whonix 14 manual upgrade
item.dc:creator: blackheart
item.description:
Thanks 0brand. Tried it, did not fix; same result.

Here’s current perms:
drwx--S--- 2 debian-tor debian-tor 4096 Nov 16 23:35 tor

Read full topic

item.description:
Hi blackheart

Can you try this please: https://whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Permissions_Fix

Related: https://forums.whonix.org/t/tor-cant-start-after-qubes-whonix-templates-reinstall-warn-directory-var-lib-tor-tor-cannot-be-read-permission-denied/6202/13

item.title: TOR not starting after Whonix 14 manual upgrade
item.dc:creator: blackheart
item.description:
Had a perfectly fine Whonix 13 running in VirtualBox on MacOS 10.13.6 when forced to update to 14 today.

On booting into 14 I get this:

whonixcheck fails Tor Pid Check Result Tor not running (tor_pid)message: Pid file /var/run/tor/tor.pid does not exist.)
Applications:System:Restart Tor reports “Failed to start Anonymizing overlay network for TCP.”

First upgraded VirtualBox app and the Oracle addons, no drama.

Followed step by step the manual upgrade directions for non-Qubes Whonix - last updated Oct 22 2018

Started with workstation, then did gateway. Once the workstation finished downloading apt-get-noninteractive dist-upgrade, I started the gateway update.

Same thing happened on both: All fine until after the final step sudo apt-get install --reinstall virtualbox-guest-* I go to save Konsole output and KDE immediately crashes. Reboot the virtual machines and TOR no longer works as described above.

I’ve seen other threads like this, but none of the solutions make any sense to my mid-level UNIX head. Could you please summarize the solution for me?

Read full topic
